articles.title: Oldest Modern Human Genome Reconstructed Using DNA From 45,000-Year-Old Skull - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The fossil skull of a woman in Czechia has provided the oldest modern human genome yet reconstructed, representing a population that formed before the ancestors of present-day Europeans and Asians split apart. In an article published in Nature Ecology & Evolu…
articles.content:
This skull from Zlatý kůň cave near Prague belonged to the earliest known modern human in Europe. Credit: Marek Jantač
